A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The filmography was beautiful\, but between the story and editing I wasn't able to connect with the movie. 

I felt like I had whiplash watching the movie jump quickly back and forth between plots.  Cuts and scenes felt rushed\, and there weren't a lot of time spent on those 'scene setting' shots you usually expect with Star Wars.

But the biggest issue was the character development. Luke Skywalker was not in any way a character you could point back to developing from the original series (especially the person he evolved into by the end of them).  And our new heroes did not seem to evolve at all from the lessons they should have learned during the course of the film.  

Characters became almost comical in an attempt to create a connection with the audience. In addition to the character development issues\, there were too many unnecessary creatures used as plot devices that felt so out of place that it was like watching a marketing team write the plot.

I wanted to like it\, but overall it felt like a lacking place holder for a story that should have been shown and not told.

Mad props to the actors\, tech teams\, and CG team though.
